summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys from the law firm Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP and an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) regarding a request for information from the Department of Justice relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss the submission of a Touhy request for documents in connection with pending litigation against Epstein's estate and the subsequent delivery of responsive documents.

events.title: Submission of Touhy Request
events.description: Alexandra Conlon, on behalf of Roberta Kaplan, sends a Touhy letter and supporting exhibit to the DOJ formally requesting documents related to Jeffrey Epstein for pending litigation.

events.title: DOJ Provides Responsive Documents
events.description: An AUSA emails Kate Doniger, attaching a response letter and a set of documents identified in the letter, fulfilling part of the Touhy request.

keyFacts: The law firm Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP was engaged in pending litigation against the estate of Jeffrey Epstein as of early 2020.
The firm submitted a formal Touhy request to the U.S. Department of Justice to obtain documents related to Jeffrey Epstein for use in that litigation.
The DOJ, via an Assistant U.S. Attorney, responded to the request and provided a set of documents in April 2020.
The correspondence highlights ongoing legal efforts to obtain government information about Epstein after his death.
